result.execSummary:
The defendant Luis Angel Otero-Rodriguez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Heroin(>3-10g), a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)2.
  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>1-5g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)1r.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
BOTH COUNTS: Provide DNA sample, if not already done. Pay court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges including the DNA surcharge to be paid through collection by the DOC's from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance shall be due no later than 12-31-2017; failure to pay will result in an entry of a civil judgment.
- Fine is set at ZERO.
Concurrent with: Any other sentence; with credit for 290 days (03-30-2014 to 04-02-2014 and 12-02-2015 to 09-12-2016) time served.

superMiscConds.notes: - Seek/maintain full-time employment/school or a combination of both.

- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- Defendant is not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $300.00 at one time.
- No possession of more than one cell phone at any one time.
- Defendant may not have more than one cell phone number registered to your name at one time.
- Dept. of corrections must conduct drug and alcohol testing.

- Maintain Absolute Sobriety: No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.

supervisions.notes: Court notes no objection to ES being transferred to Puerto Rico if authorized by the DOC's

- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.

Court advises the defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. the defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the defendant being returned to prison.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: Firearm possession and Voting.

The Court informed the defendant of requirements and penalties applicable under s.941.29(1m) or (4m).
Concurrent with: Any other sentence; with credit for 290 days (03-30-2014 to 04-02-2014 and 12-02-2015 to 09-12-2016) time served.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Luis Angel Otero-Rodriguez

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Luis Angel Otero-Rodriguez in court with attorney Melissa Nepomiachi.  Defendant Luis Angel Otero-Rodriguez in custody.  Patricia Irene Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
  
AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS, concurrent with any other sentence, with credit for 290 days (03-30-2014 to 04-02-2014 and 12-02-2015 to 09-12-2016) time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  

AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS, concurrent with any other sentence, with credit for 290 days (03-30-2014 to 04-02-2014 and 12-02-2015 to 09-12-2016) time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  

Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. 

- Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance shall be due no later than 12-31-2017; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment. 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION: (Court notes no objection to Extended Supervision being transferred to Pureto Rico if authorized by the Department of Corrections)
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety: No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.  
- Department of Corrections must conduct drug and alcohol testing.
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- Defendant is not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $300.00 at one time.
- No possession of more than one cell phone at any one time.
- Defendant my not have more than one phone number registered to your name at one time. 
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.  
- Seek/Maintain full time employment/school or a combination of both. 
- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Court advises the Defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the Defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the Defendant being returned to prison.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

The Court informed the defendant of requirements and penalties applicable under s. 941.29(1m) or (4m).

Filed;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement; 
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
Sworn as interpreter: Enrique Barbosa

Attorney Melissa Nepomiachi in court, defendant Luis Angel Otero-Rodriguez not in court, in custody.  Patricia Irene Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin, via e-mail.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.  
Held off the record. Case set for sentencing hearing. ADA Daugherty in Jury Trial on another matter. Case adjourned for sentencing hearing on 09-12-2016 at 8:30 am, branch 17.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Sworn as interpreter: Enrique Barbosa

Defendant Luis Angel Otero-Rodriguez in court with attorney Melissa Nepomiachi.  Defendant Luis Angel Otero-Rodriguez in custody.  Chad Wozniak on behalf of Patricia Irene Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Parties have reached a resolution in this matter.
Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1 AND 2 :

The defendant was advised of his Constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Court ordered the defendant REMANDED into custody.  

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, any victims, and the defendant. Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court 3 business days in advance of the sentencing. 

Case adjourned for sentencing hearing on 08-23-2016 at 8:30 am, branch 17.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 23, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Attorney's contacted the court via telephone and email to set the next date for the Defendant. Case calendared for projected guilty plea on 07/06/2016 at 08:30 am, Branch 17. LNR

Attorney Melissa Nepomiachi in court, defendant Luis Angel Otero-Rodriguez not in court, in custody, not produced.  Patricia Irene Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin via telephone.  Deputy Court Clerk: LNR
Defense Attorney in court with change of plea forms. Due to the hour and the court being in Jury Trial on another matter, case is adjourned. Defense Attorney and State to contact court tomorrow, 06/15/2016, to set a projected plea and sentencing date.

Attorney Melissa Nepomiachi in court, defendant Luis Angel Otero-Rodriguez not in court, in custody.  Patricia Irene Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin./LNR  
Held off the record. Case set for Projected plea and sentencing.  Parties request an adjournment for more time for negotiations. Case adjourned for projected plea and sentencing on 06/14/2016 at 01:30 pm, branch 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 14, 2016 at 01:30 pm. FILE RETAINED IN COURT.
Ruth Garcia.

Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Ronald Linzmeyer MPD Detective.  Exhibit 1 is marked, offered and received into evidence for the State.  State rests. Deputy court clerk ccp.
BRANCH 25 FOR BRANCH 17. Sworn as Interpreter: Enrique Barbosa. Case set for return on warrant. Warrant received and filed. Arguments heard as to bail. Court ordered cash bail set at $25,000.00 with turnover to Justice Point GPS monitoring. 24 HOUR CURFEW, absolutely no release. Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, no possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription, drug testing and breathalyzer tests. Justice Point to verify the residence prior to the defendant being released. This matter needs to be returned to preliminary court. Defense counsel WAIVED time limits. Order to Cancel Warrant signed and filed. Case adjourned to Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 6, 2016 at 08:30 am.

css

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.     The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.   No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no drugs and no alcohol.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
